de.javasoft.swing.table
Class ObjectTableCellEditor

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.AbstractCellEditor
      de.javasoft.swing.table.ObjectTableCellEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.CellEditor, javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor
public class ObjectTableCellEditor
extends javax.swing.AbstractCellEditor
implements javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor

A general TableCellEditor wrapper to enable editing by value type. JTable supports column related cell editing by default - in case that a table column contains different data types and you want to edit some data types differently, you should consider to use an ObjectTableCellEditor.

An ObjectTableCellEditor has to be set by setDefaultEditor(Class columnClass, TableCellEditor editor) to a JTable for the Object class. Data/value type related editors have to be added to the ObjectTableCellEditor by addEditor(Class dataClass, TableCellEditor editor).

The ObjectTableCellEditor delegates editing to a registered editor or to the passed default editor if no additional editor has been registered or the value type doesn't match with the class of a registered editor.

The edit mode begins by pressing the space button or by clicking into the relevant cell. By default editing starts with a single mouse button click - use setClicksToEdit(int) to modify the behavior.

Example: 

  TableCellEditor defaultEditor = table.getDefaultEditor(Object.class);
  ObjectTableCellEditor editor = new ObjectTableCellEditor(defaultEditor);
  editor.addEditor(Integer.class, new SliderTableCellEditor(defaultEditor));
  editor.addEditor(Boolean.class, new CheckBoxTableCellEditor(defaultEditor));
  table.setDefaultEditor(Object.class, editor);

Version:
1.03, 27.09.2010
